items.name: [object Object]
items.notes: Low feed input; requires good water exchange.

items.name: Carp
items.feedRequirements: Rice bran and oilcake mixtures; supplemental pellets optional
preventiveActions: Provide wintering ponds or deeper refuges
commonDiseases: Low dissolved oxygen in wintering ponds
items.russiaEuropeNotes: Requires wintering phase in cold climates; hardy omnivore for pond polyculture.

items.name: Catla
items.feedRequirements: Balanced pellets; bran and oilcake blends
items.southAsiaNotes: Surface feeder complementing Rohu and Mrigal in Indian major carp systems.

items.name: Grass Carp
items.stockingDensityPerHectare: Introduce based on weed biomass in ponds
items.southAsiaNotes: Provides weed control and additional biomass in composite carp culture.

items.name: Mrigal
items.southAsiaNotes: Bottom feeder that completes IMC polyculture alongside Rohu and Catla.

items.name: Pangasius Catfish
items.feedRequirements: High-protein pelleted feeds with strong aeration
preventiveActions: Maintain biosecurity and regular probiotic use
Ensure continuous aeration and water exchange
items.stockingDensityPerSqMeter: High density possible in intensive systems
items.southAsiaNotes: Requires intensive management with robust aeration infrastructure.

items.name: Pike-Perch
items.feedRequirements: High-quality pellets supplemented with forage fish
items.stockingNotes: Low to moderate densities in ponds or cages during warm season
items.russiaEuropeNotes: High-value predator requiring careful handling; sensitive to transport and stress.

items.name: Rohu
items.feedRequirements: Rice bran and oilcake mixture; supplement with pelleted feeds
items.southAsiaNotes: Performs best in polyculture with Catla and Mrigal; stock before monsoon.

items.name: Siberian Sturgeon
items.feedRequirements: High-protein sinking pellets; meticulous water quality management
preventiveActions: Implement biosecurity and regular health monitoring
Maintain optimal oxygen levels and clean systems
items.stockingNotes: Hatchery fingerlings stocked in intensive ponds or tanks
items.russiaEuropeNotes: Multi-year grow-out for meat and caviar; requires licensing and strict compliance.

items.name: Silver Carp
items.stockingDensityPerHectare: Stock as surface filter feeder in polyculture
items.southAsiaNotes: Improves plankton utilization with Rohu, Catla, and Mrigal.

items.name: Tilapia
items.feedRequirements: Feed 2–3% bodyweight per day using 25–30% protein pellets
preventiveActions: Perform partial harvests to manage biomass
items.fijiNotes: Well adapted to Fiji ponds; ensure aeration and regular water exchange.

items.name: Trout
items.feedRequirements: High-protein floating feeds; maintain high dissolved oxygen
preventiveActions: Maintain strict biosecurity and regular health checks
items.stockingNotes: Raceways, tanks, or cages in cold, oxygen-rich waters
commonDiseases: Off-flavor due to poor water quality
items.russiaEuropeNotes: Requires cold (<16°C), clear water; year-round production with tempered flows in Karelia and Scandinavia.

items.name: Begonia
items.notes: Maintain consistent watering; partial sun.

items.name: Chrysanthemum
items.notes: Maintain consistent watering; partial sun.

items.notes: Maintain consistent watering; partial sun.

items.notes: Maintain consistent watering; partial sun.

items.name: Beef Cattle
items.feedRequirements: Pasture grazing with haylage and mineral blocks; finish on pasture or high-energy rations
preventiveActions: Rotate pastures and provide shelter during severe cold
items.russiaEuropeNotes: Steppe grazing systems common; spring calving aligns with pasture flush and winter housing.

items.name: Broiler Chicken
items.feedRequirements: Starter, grower and finisher feeds with clean water
items.fijiNotes: Fast turnover for Fiji smallholders; ensure biosecurity to reduce losses.
items.southAsiaNotes: Commonly raised in commercial sheds; enforce biosecurity to prevent CRD and coccidiosis.

items.name: Buffalo
items.feedRequirements: Green fodder plus concentrate; access to wallowing or sprinklers
preventiveActions: Conduct routine deworming and maintain hygiene
items.southAsiaNotes: Thrives in hot-humid tracts; high-fat milk preferred for dairy processing.

items.name: Dairy Cattle
items.feedRequirements: Rotational pasture or green fodder with concentrate and mineral mix
preventiveActions: Maintain milking hygiene and schedule deworming
items.fijiNotes: Requires consistent pasture rotation and mineral supplementation in Fiji.
items.southAsiaNotes: Heat-tolerant indigenous breeds (Gir, Sahiwal) perform well under hot climates.

items.name: Duck
items.feedRequirements: Balanced poultry mash supplemented with scavenged feed; ensure clean water
preventiveActions: Vaccinate and provide sanitary water bodies
Maintain litter hygiene and periodic deworming
items.southAsiaNotes: Suited to wetlands and backwaters; integrate with paddy for pest control.

items.name: Goat
items.feedRequirements: Grazing plus tree leaves and supplemental mineral lick
preventiveActions: Vaccinate against PPR as per regional program
items.southAsiaNotes: Adapted to dryland and backyard systems; ensure shelter during monsoon.

items.name: Layer Chicken
items.feedRequirements: Layer mash with 16–18% protein and high calcium for shell quality
preventiveActions: Monitor and manage external parasites in housing
items.southAsiaNotes: Temperature moderation inside sheds maintains egg production.

items.name: Pig
items.fijiNotes: Performs well in humid tropics; maintain housing hygiene to limit disease.
items.southAsiaNotes: Popular in North-East India and Bangladesh; maintain hygiene and vaccination schedules.

items.name: Sheep
items.feedRequirements: Grazing with supplemental fodder or concentrates in stall-fed systems
items.southAsiaNotes: Suited to arid and semi-arid belts; manage shade and water during peak heat.
items.russiaEuropeNotes: Romanov sheep are cold-hardy and prolific for fibre and meat in continental winters.

items.name: Bananas
items.spacing: 1.8 x 1.8 m (adjust per variety and density)
items.fertilizerRequirements: Apply FYM 10–20 t/ha with fertigation emphasizing potassium
preventiveActions: Use tissue-culture plants and maintain sanitation
Implement windbreaks and propping in cyclone-prone areas
items.southAsiaNotes: Provide windbreaks and drainage; propping reduces lodging in monsoon winds.

items.name: Barley
items.notes: Provide balanced NPK fertilizer before planting.
preventiveActions: Use crop rotation and seed treatment
Apply fungicide programs when disease thresholds are reached
items.fertilizerRequirements: Balanced NPK with sulfur addition for malting quality
items.russiaEuropeNotes: Hardy, short-season grain for feed and brewing across Russia, Ukraine, and Baltic states.

items.name: Beans
items.notes: Rotate with cereals to improve nitrogen balance.

items.name: Beets
items.notes: Avoid water logging to prevent rot.

items.name: Buckwheat
items.fertilizerRequirements: Low input; prefers light, well-drained soils
preventiveActions: Time sowing to avoid late frosts during bloom
Encourage pollinator activity for better seed set
items.russiaEuropeNotes: Quick-maturing pseudo-cereal valued for honey and grain in Altai and Baltic regions.

items.name: Cabbage
items.fertilizerRequirements: Basal NPK with side-dressed nitrogen; lime acidic soils
preventiveActions: Apply lime to maintain pH above 6.5
Implement IPM and rotation to break pest cycles
items.russiaEuropeNotes: Late-storage cultivars for winter supplies; manage clubroot with liming and rotations.

items.name: Carrots
items.notes: Avoid water logging to prevent rot.
items.plantingSeason: Fiji: April–September; Russia/Europe: Sow April–May, harvest August–September
items.fertilizerRequirements: Poultry manure 10 t/ha; NPK 200 kg/ha
preventiveActions: Apply Mancozeb or Kocide as needed
items.fijiNotes: Requires loose soil for straight roots; ideal for Fiji's cool-season districts.
items.russiaEuropeNotes: Use Nantes/Flakkee types; protect against Alternaria and root fly with seed treatment and netting.

items.name: Cassava
items.notes: Avoid water logging to prevent rot.

items.name: Chickpeas
items.notes: Rotate with cereals to improve nitrogen balance.
preventiveActions: Cultivate resistant varieties and treat seed
Use pheromone traps and IPM for pod borer
items.fertilizerRequirements: Starter nitrogen, adequate phosphorus, and Rhizobium inoculation
items.southAsiaNotes: Requires cool, dry season; terminal drought reduces pod fill.

items.name: Cowpeas
items.notes: Rotate with cereals to improve nitrogen balance.

items.name: Faba beans
items.notes: Rotate with cereals to improve nitrogen balance.

items.name: Ginger
items.notes: Avoid water logging to prevent rot.

items.name: Lentils
items.notes: Rotate with cereals to improve nitrogen balance.

items.name: Maize
items.notes: Provide balanced NPK fertilizer before planting.
preventiveActions: Deploy pheromone traps and IPM interventions
items.plantingSeason: Kharif and Rabi windows depending on agro-climatic zone
items.spacing: 60–75 cm rows x 20–25 cm between plants
items.fertilizerRequirements: Basal NPK with split nitrogen; ensure good drainage and weed control
items.southAsiaNotes: Avoid waterlogging; vigilant scouting for fall armyworm is essential.

items.name: Mangoes
items.fertilizerRequirements: Annual FYM plus NPK; supplement micronutrients as needed
preventiveActions: Deploy bait traps and timely sprays
items.southAsiaNotes: Alternate bearing requires canopy management and flower induction practices.

items.name: Millet
items.notes: Provide balanced NPK fertilizer before planting.

items.name: Mustard
items.fertilizerRequirements: Balanced NPK with sulfur supplementation and micronutrients as needed
preventiveActions: Treat seed and maintain field sanitation
items.southAsiaNotes: Cool temperatures during flowering improve pod set and oil content.

items.name: Oats
items.notes: Provide balanced NPK fertilizer before planting.
preventiveActions: Treat seed with fungicide before sowing
items.fertilizerRequirements: Moderate nitrogen; add potassium on light soils
items.russiaEuropeNotes: Performs on acidic soils in Belarus and Baltic states; short growing season friendly.

items.name: Onions
items.fertilizerRequirements: Basal phosphorus and potassium; split nitrogen doses; avoid standing water
preventiveActions: Rotate fungicides and use sticky traps
Maintain field hygiene and irrigation discipline
items.southAsiaNotes: Cure bulbs thoroughly for storage and reduce post-harvest losses.

items.name: Pearl millet
items.notes: Provide balanced NPK fertilizer before planting.
preventiveActions: Adopt resistant hybrids and treat seed with fungicide
items.fertilizerRequirements: Apply basal NPK; supplement micronutrients on deficient soils
items.southAsiaNotes: Performs well on marginal soils with limited rainfall.

items.name: Peas
items.notes: Rotate with cereals to improve nitrogen balance.

items.name: Peppers
items.fertilizerRequirements: Poultry manure 10 t/ha; apply NPK (13-13-13) at 200 kg/ha
preventiveActions: Apply Benomyl, Kocide or Dimethoate as required
items.fijiNotes: Cool-season crop in Fiji highlands; ensure consistent soil moisture and pest monitoring.

items.name: Pigeon peas
items.notes: Rotate with cereals to improve nitrogen balance.

items.name: Potatoes
items.notes: Avoid water logging to prevent rot.
items.plantingSeason: South Asia: Rabi (plains) and summer (hills); Russia/Europe: Plant May, harvest Aug–Sep
items.fertilizerRequirements: Basal NPK with earthing up; treat seed tubers before planting
preventiveActions: Use certified seed and adopt protective sprays
Ensure irrigation scheduling to prevent stress
items.southAsiaNotes: Requires cool nights; irrigation critical during tuber bulking.
items.russiaEuropeNotes: Cool summer nights in Karelia and Baltic regions favor tuber bulking; manage Colorado beetle.

items.name: Radish
items.notes: Avoid water logging to prevent rot.

items.name: Rice
items.notes: Provide balanced NPK fertilizer before planting.
preventiveActions: Plant resistant varieties and treat seed before sowing
Adopt integrated pest management (IPM) including pheromone traps and need-based sprays
items.plantingSeason: Kharif (June–October) and Rabi (November–February in South India)
items.spacing: 20 x 15 cm for transplanted puddled fields
items.fertilizerRequirements: Basal NPK with top-dress nitrogen; maintain puddled fields and standing water
items.southAsiaNotes: Monsoon-dependent production; ensure consistent water depth during vegetative growth.
items.russiaEuropeNotes: Storage cultivars cured well ensure winter supply in Belarus and Gomel regions.

items.name: Rye
items.notes: Provide balanced NPK fertilizer before planting.
preventiveActions: Use clean, treated seed and rotate with non-host crops
Employ fungicides if disease pressure builds
items.fertilizerRequirements: Moderate nitrogen; balance nutrients to prevent lodging
items.russiaEuropeNotes: Extremely frost tolerant; thrives on sandy soils with protective snow cover.

items.name: Sorghum
items.notes: Provide balanced NPK fertilizer before planting.
preventiveActions: Sow early to escape pest pressure
items.plantingSeason: Kharif (rainfed) and Rabi (post-rain) depending on zone
items.fertilizerRequirements: Basal NPK; tolerant to moderate drought
items.southAsiaNotes: Key staple in semi-arid tropics; also used for fodder and silage.

items.name: Soybeans
items.notes: Rotate with cereals to improve nitrogen balance.
items.fertilizerRequirements: Inoculate seed with Rhizobium; ensure balanced phosphorus and potassium
items.southAsiaNotes: Waterlogging severely affects nodulation and yield; ensure drainage.

items.name: Sugar beet
items.fertilizerRequirements: High NPK demand; supply boron on deficient soils
preventiveActions: Use boron sprays and improve drainage
items.coldNotes: Core crop in south/central Russia and Europe; irrigation boosts root yield.

items.name: Sugarcane
items.plantingSeason: February–April or September–October depending on region
items.spacing: Ridges 90–120 cm apart with 2–3 bud setts per furrow
items.fertilizerRequirements: High NPK doses supplemented with organic manures and trash mulching
preventiveActions: Use healthy, treated setts and rogue infected stools
Maintain trash mulching and integrated pest management
items.southAsiaNotes: Requires assured irrigation and high nutrient inputs for optimal cane yields.

items.name: Sunflower
items.fertilizerRequirements: Balanced NPK; avoid excessive nitrogen to reduce lodging
preventiveActions: Adopt tolerant hybrids and rotate away from susceptible crops
Apply fungicides when disease pressure builds
items.russiaEuropeNotes: Major oilseed crop across Ukraine and southern Russia; maintain wider rotations to curb Sclerotinia.

items.name: Sweet potatoes
items.notes: Avoid water logging to prevent rot.

items.name: Taro
items.notes: Avoid water logging to prevent rot.
items.fertilizerRequirements: Organic manure 10 t/ha
items.fijiNotes: Thrives in wet lowlands; essential staple known locally as Dalo.

items.name: Tomatoes
items.plantingSeason: Multiple windows, avoid peak heat or heavy rains
items.fertilizerRequirements: Basal NPK plus organic manures; mulching and fertigation recommended
preventiveActions: Stake and prune plants; use drip irrigation
Adopt IPM nets and targeted sprays
items.southAsiaNotes: Optimum at 20–25°C; staggered planting maintains continuous supply.

items.name: Triticale
items.notes: Provide balanced NPK fertilizer before planting.

items.name: Turmeric
items.notes: Avoid water logging to prevent rot.

items.name: Turnips
items.notes: Avoid water logging to prevent rot.

items.name: Vanilla
items.notes: Requires trellising and hand pollination; pods mature 8–9 months after pollination.
items.fijiNotes: Shade-loving vine; maintain humidity and provide regular pruning.

items.name: Wheat
items.notes: Provide balanced NPK fertilizer before planting.
preventiveActions: Seed dressing and timely fungicide/insecticide sprays
Maintain snow cover and stubble to protect winter stands
items.plantingSeason: South Asia: Rabi (November–April); Russia/Europe: Winter sow Sep–Oct, harvest July; spring types Apr–May
items.fertilizerRequirements: Basal NPK; top-dress nitrogen at tillering and booting stages; split N for winter wheat systems
items.southAsiaNotes: Requires cool, dry winters for proper grain filling across the Indo-Gangetic plains.
items.russiaEuropeNotes: Winter wheat sown in Krasnodar/Kuban benefits from snow cover; manage stripe rust and snow mold.

items.name: Yams
items.notes: Avoid water logging to prevent rot.
